article.headline: Pennsylvania 65, Yale 41
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Steve Danley scored a career-high 16 points to lead Penn to a 65-41 victory over Yale on Friday as both teams opened Ivy League play. Tim Begley had 15 points and Mark Zoller 14 for Penn (8-7, 1-0), which won its fourth in a row. Edwin Draughan had 10 points for the Bulldogs (4-10, 0-1), who were held to their lowest point total of the season. Yale was playing for the first time in 13 days. The Quakers hit five of their first six shots to jump to an 11-0 lead and were never seriously threatened. A 3-point shot by Begley gave Penn a 29-14 advantage, and the Quakers held a 37-22 halftime edge, connecting on 16 of 32 shots, while Yale was only 8-for-23. A 12-4 run at the start of the second half boosted the margin to 49-26 and the Quakers took their biggest lead, 62-32 with 4:40 left, on a 3-point play by Ryan Pettinell.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
